intro: Hosackia incana, commonly known as the hoary vetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its hairy stems and small, yellowish-white flowers are distinctive botanical features. Hosackia incana is valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators.
